parallel

Class ConditionCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.ConditionCounter

  • public class ConditionCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    implements a "condition" counter, so that when the object's counter reaches a specified number, it releases a notification for any waiting thread to resume execution. The class is useful in combination with the parallel.ParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor class.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long _count 
      private boolean _isSatisfied 
      private long _target 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConditionCounter()
      public no-arg constructor, sets the object's taget count to zero.
      ConditionCounter(long t)
      specifies the target for the counter to reach (exactly).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(long c)
      increments object's counter by c, and issues a notification if the counter after the update equals the target.
      void await()
      causes the current thread to wait until a notification is issued by another thread invoking one of the other methods of this object that issue notifications.
      void decrement()
      decrements object's counter by 1, and issues a notification if the counter after the update equals the target.
      long getCount()
      get the current count value.
      long getTarget()
      get the target value of this counter.
      void increment()
      increments object's counter by 1, and issues a notification if the counter after the update equals the target.
      void reset()
      resets this object's counter to zero, and sets the object's _isSatisfied flag to false, for use in another "countdown" process.
      void subtract(long c)
      decrements object's counter by c, and issues a notification if the counter after the update equals the target.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
